cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving slowly west-southwest today, turning west then west-northwest Friday, and curving northwest toward the central Louisiana coast this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch and Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Morgan City (TS watch); Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City (Storm Surge watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire central and southeast Louisiana coast, including Plaquemines Parish, with effects extending into Mississippi and eastern Texas coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (gusts 40–50 mph) are possible late Thursday night into Friday, with a 30% cumulative chance of 34-kt winds and a 5% chance of 50-kt winds at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft above ground possible along the lower Mississippi River delta including Plaquemines Parish if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with isolated totals near 18 inches are forecast, creating a high risk of flash flooding and river flooding in and around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated river stages, possible levee overtopping, strong currents in the Mississippi River channel, and hazardous seas that will disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations.
